com.vividsolutions.jcs.conflate.polygonmatch
Class AngleHistogramMatcher

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--com.vividsolutions.jcs.conflate.polygonmatch.IndependentCandidateMatcher
        |
        +--com.vividsolutions.jcs.conflate.polygonmatch.AngleHistogramMatcher
All Implemented Interfaces:
FeatureMatcher
public class AngleHistogramMatcher
extends IndependentCandidateMatcher

Matches geometries by comparing their "angle histograms". An angle histogram is a histogram of segment angles (with the positive x-axis), weighted by segment length. Angles range from -pi to +pi.

Constructor Summary
AngleHistogramMatcher()
          Creates an AngleHistogramMatcher with 0 bins.
AngleHistogramMatcher(int binCount)
          Creates an AngleHistogramMatcher with the given number of bins.

match

protected double match(com.vividsolutions.jump.feature.Feature target,
                       com.vividsolutions.jump.feature.Feature candidate)
Finds the symmetric difference between the angle histograms of the two features.
Overrides:
match in class IndependentCandidateMatcher
Parameters:
target - the feature to match
candidate - the feature to compare with the target
Returns:
a linear function of the symmetric difference: 1 if the histograms perfectly overlap; 0 if they do not overlap at all.

angleHistogram

public Histogram angleHistogram(com.vividsolutions.jts.geom.Geometry g,
                                int binCount)
Creates an angle histogram for the given Geometry. The sum of the histogram scores will equal the sum of the Geometry's segment lengths.
Parameters:
g - the Geometry to analyze
binCount - the number of bins into which -pi to +pi should be split
Returns:
a histogram of g's segment angles (with the positive x-axis), weighted by segment length

bin

public int bin(double angle,
               int binCount)
Returns the histogram bin that the angle should go into.
Parameters:
angle - in radians
binCount - the number of bins into which -pi to pi is divided
Returns:
the index of the bin that the angle should go into (0, 1, 2, ...)
